item.title: Jeremiah 1
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 1

1The Words of Jeremiah Ben-Hilkiah from the Priests at Anathoth in Benjamin

2Messages from Yahveh came to him in the thirteenth year of Josiah Ben-Amon, king of Judah. 3They came as well during the reign of Jehoiakim Ben-Josiah, king of Judah, till the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah Ben-Josiah, king of Judah, till Jerusalem’s exile in the fifth month.

Jer 1:1-3

The Call of Jeremiah

4A message from Yahveh came to me: 5“I knew you before I formed you in the womb; I set you apart before you were born and appointed you as a prophet to the nations.”

item.title: Jeremiah 2
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 2

1A Message from Yahveh came to Me: 2“Go proclaim in Jerusalem that Yahveh says, ‘I remember your devotion when you were young, your love as my betrothed, your following me in the open country through uncultivated land.

3Israel was holy to me, the first fruits of my harvest. Everybody that tried to eat some of it became guilty, and disaster fell on them.’”

item.title: Jeremiah 3
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 3

1God says, “If a husband divorces his wife and she marries another man, will he take her back? Wouldn’t that pollute the land? But you’re a prostitute with lots of lovers; yet you turn back to me to get help.

2Look up at the barren hills; where haven’t you committed adultery? You sit by the roads waiting for them like a nomad in the desert. You pollute the land with your sinful prostitution.

item.title: Jeremiah 4
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 4

1“If you want to come back, you can; get rid of your detestable idols and don’t waver back and forth with them.

2Swear, ‘As sure as Yahveh lives,’ honestly, justly, uprightly; then the nations will be blessed in him and glory in him.” Coming Destruction from the North

3Yahveh says to the people in Judah and Jerusalem: “Break up your heart’s fallow ground and don’t throw your seed among its thorns.

item.title: Jeremiah 5
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 5

1“Wander back and forth in the streets in Jerusalem; search all around in it. Look in its open squares: if you can find one honest person, one that looks for the truth, I’ll pardon it.

2Although they swear, ‘As sure as Yahveh lives,’ they don’t mean it.

3Yahveh, aren’t you looking for honesty? You’ve struck them, but they didn’t feel anything; you’ve consumed them, but they’ve refused to be corrected; they’ve set their faces like stone and refused to repent.”

item.title: Jeremiah 6
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 6

1“People of Benjamin, get out of Jerusalem! Blow a bugle in Tekoa, sound the ram’s horn over Beth-haccerem, because great destruction looms down from the north.

2I’ll destroy attractive, delicate Zion. 3‘Shepherds’ [commanders] will lead their companies there and pitch camps around it, each with his own area to subdue.

4Get ready for war with it; get up! attack at noon! But misfortune would await us; it’s getting late; shadows are getting longer.

item.title: Jeremiah 7
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 7

1A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah Jeremiah Speaks at the Temple 2“Stand in the entrance to Yahveh’s Temple and deliver this message, ‘Listen to a message from Yahveh, all of you in Judah that go in these gates to worship him! 3If you mend your ways, I’ll let you live here. 4Don’t trust in these deceptive words, “This is Yahveh’s Temple, Yahveh’s Temple, Yahveh’s Temple!” 5If you mend your ways and practice goodness with one another,

item.title: Jeremiah 8
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 8

1Yahveh says, “At that time, they’ll bring out of their graves the bones of Judah’s kings, its officials, priests, prophets, and the people of Jerusalem. 2They’ll spread them out to the sun, moon, and stars, which they’ve loved, served, and worshiped. They won’t be gathered up or buried. They’ll be like manure on the ground. 3The remnant of this evil family will chose death rather than life.

item.title: Jeremiah 9
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 9

1Oh that my head was a body of water and my eyes a fountain of tears, so I could weep day and night for my people slain!

2I wish I had an inn in the desert, so I could escape from my people; because they’re all adulterers, a pack of liars. 3“They bend their tongues like bows; lies, not truth, dominate the land. The people move from one sin to another; they don’t know me.

item.title: Jeremiah 10
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 10

1Listen to the message Yahveh’s giving you, Israel: 2“Don’t pick up the ways other nations live; don’t let the signs in the sky terrify you that terrify them.

3Their customs are delusions. They cut down a tree in the woods, and their craftsmen carve it with a tool;

4 4they decorate it with silver and gold and fasten it down with hammer and nails so it won’t shift.

item.title: Jeremiah 11
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 11

1A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah Judah’s Broken Covenant 2“Listen to this covenant and tell the people in Judah and Jerusalem 3that Yahveh God of Israel says, ‘People are under a curse who ignore the covenant 4that I commanded your ancestors when I brought them out of Egypt, the iron furnace. I said, “If you listen to what I’m telling you, you’ll be my people, and I’ll be your God.” 5Doing what I tell you confirms the oath I swore to give you a land flowing with milk and honey, like it is now.’” I answered, “Yes, Yahveh.”

item.title: Jeremiah 12
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 12

1You render justice, Yahveh, so I’ll argue my case to you. Why do the wicked prosper, and the devious live in ease?

2You planted them and they took root; they grew and bore fruit. You’re near their lips but far from their mind.

3But, Yahveh, you know me; you see me. You examine my attitude toward you. Drag them off like sheep for slaughter; set them apart to be butchered.

item.title: Jeremiah 13
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 13

1Yahveh told me, “Go buy a linen waistcloth and put it on. Don’t wash it.”

2So I bought one and put it on.

3Then he said, 4“Take it to the Euphrates and hide it in a crevice in a rock.” 5So I went and hid it there. 6A long time later, Yahveh told me to go get it. 7I went and dug it out of where I’d put it. It was ruined.

item.title: Jeremiah 14
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 14

1A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah About the Drought 2“In Judah’s towns, commerce has died off at their gates; the people sit on the ground mourning; their outcry goes up from Jerusalem.

3Nobles send servants to draw water, but the cisterns are dry. They come back with empty pots, demoralized and covering their heads.

Jer 14:1-3

4The ground is cracked because there’s been no rain; farmers are demoralized, too, and cover their heads.

item.title: Jeremiah 15
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 15

1Then Yahveh told me, “Even if Moses and Samuel were standing here, my heart wouldn’t be with this nation. Send them away! 2If they ask you where to go, tell them Yahveh says, ‘Those destined for death, go to death! Those destined for the sword, go to the sword! Those destined for famine, go to famine! Those destined for captivity, go to captivity!’

3I’ll send four kinds of destruction on you: the sword to slay, dogs to drag away, buzzards to devour, and scavengers to consume. 4I’ll see that the kingdoms abhor you because of what Manasseh Ben-Hezekiah, king of Judah, did in Jerusalem.

item.title: Jeremiah 16
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 16

1A Message from Yahveh of Hosts, the God of Israel, That Came to Me Day of Disaster 2“Don’t get married or have children here.” 3This is what Yahveh says about children born here and their parents, 4“They’ll die from disease, not mourned or buried. They’ll come to an end by sword and famine, and lie like manure on the ground. Their dead bodies will feed the buzzards from the sky and the scavengers on the ground.

item.title: Jeremiah 17
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 17

1“Judah’s sin is recorded with an iron stylus; with a diamond point it’s engraved on their heart and the horns on their altars.

2As well as they remember their children, they remember their pagan altars and Asherah poles beside every green tree on the tall hills.

3My mountain in the open country, I’ll give your wealth and treasures for spoil as the price for your sin throughout your territory.

item.title: Jeremiah 18
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 18

1A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah The Potter’s Shop 2“Go down to the potter’s shop. I’ll give you my message there.”

3When I got down to his shop, he was there, working at his wheel. 4But the jar he was making with his hands didn’t come out the way he wanted; so he made another one out of it that he was satisfied with.

Jer 18:1-4

item.title: Jeremiah 19
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 19

1Yahveh says, “Go buy a clay pot. Take some elders and senior priests along 2to the Valley of (Ben)Hinnom by the entrance to the Potsherd Gate. Deliver my message there, 3‘Listen to a message from Yahveh, kings of Judah and people of Jerusalem. I’m about to bring such catastrophe here that will make everybody’s ears ring when they hear about it. 4You’ve abandoned me and made this a foreign place, and burned sacrifices here to gods that you, your ancestors, and the kings of Judah never knew. You’ve filled it with innocent people’s blood 5and built high places for Baal so you can burn your sons as offerings to him. I never commanded that. Such a thing never even entered my mind! 6So the time’s coming when this place won’t be called Topheth or The Valley of (Ben)Hinnom, but The Valley of Slaughter. 7I’ll void the plans that Judah and Jerusalem have. I’ll make them fall by the sword and give their carcasses to buzzards from the sky and scavengers on the ground. 8This city will be desolate, something to gasp at. Everybody that goes by will marvel at its disaster. 9They’ll eat their sons and daughters during the siege and distress their enemies bring on them.’

item.title: Jeremiah 20
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 20

1When Pashhur Ben-Immer, the priest in charge of Yahveh’s Temple, heard Jeremiah prophesying that, 2he had him beaten and put in stocks at the upper Benjamin Gate of the Temple. 3The next day, when Pashhur released him from the stocks, Jeremiah told him, “Yahveh doesn’t call you Pashhur, but The Man Surrounded by Terror. 4He says, ‘I’m going to make you a terror to yourself and your friends. While you watch, they’ll fall by their enemies’ sword. I’ll turn Judah over to the king of Babylon to carry away and kill. 5I’ll turn over this city’s wealth, its produce, its expensive things, the treasures of Judah’s kings to take to Babylon. 6Pashhur, you, everybody in your house, and the friends you’ve falsely prophesied for will go into captivity and be buried in Babylon.’”

item.title: Jeremiah 21
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 21

1A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah When King Zedekiah Sent Him Pashhur Ben-Malchijah and Zephaniah Ben-Maaseiah, the Priest Jerusalem to Fall to Nebuchadnezzar 2“Inquire from Yahveh for us; Nebuchadnezzar is attacking us. Maybe Yahveh will show us one of his wonderful acts so our enemy will withdraw.”

Jer 21:1-2

3Jeremiah told them, “Tell Zedekiah 4that Yahveh God of Israel says, ‘I’m going to make your weapons useless for fighting those who are laying siege outside the wall. I’ll let them come to the center of the city. 5I’ll fight you myself with outstretched hand and strong arm in anger, wrath, and fury. 6I’ll strike down people and animals with a severe plague. 7After that, I’ll turn over to Nebuchadnezzar, Zedekiah, his officials, and people that survive the sword, famine, and disease. He won’t spare, he won’t pity, he won’t have mercy.’

item.title: Jeremiah 22
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 22

1Yahveh says, “Go to the king’s palace in Judah and say, 2‘Listen to this message from Yahveh, king of Judah on David’s throne—you, your officials, and your people that come in these gates. 3“Be just and good. Deliver from their oppressors those who’ve been robbed. Don’t mistreat foreigners, orphans, or widows, or shed innocent blood here. 4If you do that, kings who sit on David’s throne will come in these palace gates with attendants riding in chariots and on horses. 5If you won’t, I swear by myself that this palace will be empty.”’”

item.title: Jeremiah 24
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 24

1Nebuchadrezzar/Nebuchadnezzar took to Babylon Jeconiah/Jehoiachin Ben-Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and the officials in Judah along with the craftsmen and artisans. Then Yahveh showed me two baskets of figs sitting in front of the Temple. 2One basket had nice figs in it, like first-ripe ones; the other basket held rotten ones.

3He said, “What do you see, Jeremiah?” I said, “Figs, really good ones and really bad ones you can’t eat because they’re rotten.”

item.title: Jeremiah 25
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 25

1A Message to Jeremiah About the People in Judah in the Fourth Year of Jehoiakim Ben-Josiah, King of Judah (the First Year of Nebuchadnezzar King of Babylon) Seventy Years of Captivity

2Jeremiah told the people in Judah and Jerusalem: 3“From the thirteenth year of Josiah Ben-Amon, king of Judah, till now (23 years), Yahveh’s message has been coming to me. I’ve spoken to you again and again, but you’ve ignored me. 4He has sent you his prophets over and over, 5‘Turn from your sinful ways and deeds, and live on the land I’ve given you and your ancestors forever. 6Don’t worship and serve other gods. Don’t make me angry with what you’ve made with your hands, and I won’t hurt you.’ 7But you ignored me and made me angry with what you’ve made with your hands to your own hurt.

item.title: Jeremiah 26
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 26

1A Message from Yahveh at the Beginning of the Reign of Jehoiakim Ben-Josiah, King of Judah Jeremiah Escapes Death

2Yahveh says, “Stand in the court of Yahveh’s Temple and speak to the towns in Judah that have come to worship here. Don’t hold back a word! 3Maybe they’ll listen so I can change my mind about the catastrophe I’m planning for them. 4Tell them, ‘If you won’t follow the Law I’ve given you 5or listen to the prophets I’ve sent you time and again, 6then I’ll make this Temple like Shiloh and this city accursed to every nation.’”

item.title: Jeremiah 27
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 27

1A Message to Jeremiah from Yahveh at the Beginning of the Reign of Zedekiah Ben-Josiah, King of Judah Jeremiah Wears an Ox Yoke 2“Make yokes and straps and put them on your neck. 3Send back a message to the kings of Edom, Moab, the Ammonites, Tyre, and Sidon by the couriers that come to Jerusalem to Zedekiah. 4Have them tell their masters, ‘Yahveh of Hosts, the God of Israel, says, 5“By my power I made the world, its people and animals. I’ll give it to whoever pleases me. 6I’ve given these countries to Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, my servant. I’ve even given him the wild animals. 7Every nation will serve him, his son, and his grandson till the time when many nations and great kings make him and his land their servant.

item.title: Jeremiah 28
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 28

1That same year in the fifth month, fourth year of Zedekiah’s reign, Hananiah Ben-Azzur, a prophet from Gibeon, spoke to me in Yahveh’s Temple with the priests and the people standing there: 2“Yahveh of Hosts, the God of Israel, says, ‘I’ve broken the yoke of the king of Babylon. 3Within two years I’ll bring back the articles from Yahveh’s Temple that Nebuchadnezzar took to Babylon. 4I’ll also bring back Jeconiah, king of Judah, and all the exiles from Judah that went to Babylon. I’ll break the yoke of the king of Babylon.’”

item.title: Jeremiah 29
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 29

1The Letter Jeremiah Sent from Jerusalem to the Rest of the Elders, Priests, Prophets, and People Nebuchadnezzar Had Taken from Jerusalem to Babylon Jeremiah’s Letter to the Exiles (2This was after King Jeconiah/Jehoiachin, the queen mother, the court officials, the other officials of Judah and Jerusalem, the craftsmen and smiths were deported from Jerusalem.) 3Jeremiah sent the letter by Elasah Ben-Shaphan and Gemariah Ben-Hilkiah, ambassadors Zedekiah, king of Judah, sent to Babylon: Jer 29:1-3 4“Yahveh of Hosts, the God of Israel, says to the exiles he’s sent from Jerusalem to Babylon, 5‘Build houses and live in them; plant gardens and eat what they grow. 6Get married and have sons and daughters. Take wives for your sons and give your daughters to husbands to have sons and daughters. Multiply there, don’t decrease. 7Look out for the welfare of the city where I’ve sent you. Pray to me on its behalf; in its welfare you’ll fair well. 8Don’t let your prophets and fortunetellers mislead you with their dreams. 9They’re lying in my name. I haven’t sent them. 10“At the end

item.title: Jeremiah 30
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 30

1A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah A Promise to Restore Israel 2“Yahveh God of Israel says, ‘Write in a scroll everything I’ve told you, 3because the time’s coming when I’ll restore the fortunes of Israel and Judah. I’ll bring my people back to take over the land I gave their ancestors.’”

4This is what Yahveh said about Israel and Judah: 5“I’ve heard the sound of terror and dread; there’s no peace.

item.title: Jeremiah 31
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 31

1“At that time,” Yahveh says, “I’ll be the God of every family in Israel, and they’ll be my people.

2The people that survived the sword found grace in the desert when Israel was looking for rest.”

3Yahveh appeared to him from afar and said, “I’ve loved you with enduring love; so I’ve drawn you with lovingkindness.

4I’ll rebuild you, virgin of Israel! You’ll pick up your tambourines again and join the dance.

item.title: Jeremiah 32
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 32

1A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah in the Tenth Year of Zedekiah, King of Judah (Eighteenth Year of Nebuchadnezzar) Jeremiah Buys a Field 2-3Babylon’s army was laying siege to Jerusalem. Zedekiah had shut Jeremiah up in the courtyard of the guard in the royal palace, and said, “Why do you prophesy that Yahveh says, ‘I’m about to give the city to the king of Babylon. 4Zedekiah won’t escape; the king of Babylon will speak to him face to face. 5He’ll take him to Babylon till I visit him. If you fight the Babylonians, you’ll lose’?”

item.title: Jeremiah 33
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 33

1Yahveh’s Second Message to Jeremiah While Confined in the Courtyard of the Guard

2This is what Yahveh says who made the earth, formed and established it: 3“Call out to me, and I’ll tell you important things you don’t know.” 4The God of Israel says this about the houses in this city—including the palace of Judah’s kings—that were torn down to get materials for defending against the siege mounds and the sword, 5“They’re coming to fight the Babylonians and fill the houses with the corpses of men that in my anger I’ve destined to die. I withdrew because of their sinfulness. 6Later I’ll bring them health and healing, and show them true prosperity and peace. 7I’ll restore the fortunes of Judah and Israel and rebuild them like they were before. 8I’ll cleanse them from their sin against me. 9This city will have a world-wide reputation for joy, praise, and honor to me. The nations will hear about the good I’m doing for it, and tremble at the peace I’m making for it.”

item.title: Jeremiah 34
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 34

1A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah When Nebuchadnezzar, King of Babylon, and His Army and the Kingdoms He Ruled Were Fighting Jerusalem and Surrounding Towns A Warning to Zedekiah

2Go tell Zedekiah, king of Judah, that Yahveh says, “I’m giving this city to the king of Babylon, and he’ll burn it. 3You’ll be captured and turned over to him. You’ll see him in person, he’ll speak to you directly, and you’ll go to Babylon.” 4But listen to Yahveh, Zedekiah! “You won’t die by the sword; 5you’ll die in peace. As they burned spices for the kings before you, they’ll burn spices and lament, ‘Ah, lord!’ for you. I’ve spoken.”

item.title: Jeremiah 35
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 35

1A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah at the Time of Jehoiakim Ben-Josiah, King of Judah The Obedience of the Racabites 2“Go bring the Rechabites to a room in Yahveh’s Temple and offer them wine.”

3I took Jaazaniah Ben-Jeremiah Ben-Habazziniah, his brothers and sons—the whole family of Rechabites—4to Yahveh’s Temple to the office for the sons of Hanan Ben-Igdaliah, the man of God. It was close to the officials’ quarters, above the room for Maaseiah Ben-Shallum, the doorkeeper. 5I put pitchers of wine and cups in front of the Rechabites, “Have a drink!”

item.title: Jeremiah 36
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 36

1A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah in the Fourth Year of Jehoiakim Ben-Josiah, King of Judah, Baruch Reads Aloud Yahveh’s Messages 2“On a scroll, write down everything I’ve told you about Israel, Judah, and the nations from Josiah’s time till now. 3Maybe Judah will listen to the catastrophe I intend to bring on them to get them to repent. Then I’ll forgive their sin.”

4Jeremiah called for Baruch Ben-Neriah, and he wrote down Yahveh’s messages that Jeremiah dictated. 5He told Baruch, “I can’t go to Yahveh’s Temple. 6So you go on a fast day and read to the people the messages you’ve written. Read them to the people in Judah who come from their towns. 7Maybe they’ll turn from their sinful ways and ask for his forgiveness. Yahveh has pronounced great anger against them.”

item.title: Jeremiah 37
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 37

1Zedekiah Ben-Josiah, that Nebuchadnezzar had appointed king in Judah, ruled in place of Coniah Ben-Jehoiakim. 2But he, his attendants, and the people that were left ignored what Yahveh said through Jeremiah.

3Yet King Zedekiah sent Jehucal Ben-Shelemiah and Zephaniah Ben-Maaseiah the priest to Jeremiah to say, “Pray to Yahveh our God on our behalf.” 4Jeremiah was still moving freely among the people because they hadn’t put him in prison yet. 5Meantime, Pharaoh’s army had set out from Egypt. When the Babylonians besieging Jerusalem heard about that, they lifted the siege.

item.title: Jeremiah 38
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 38

1Shephatiah Ben-Mattan, Gedaliah Ben-Pashhur, Jucal Ben-Shelemiah, and Pashhur Ben-Malchijah heard what Jeremiah was telling the people: 2“Yahveh says, ‘If you stay in the city, you’ll die by sword, famine, and disease. If you surrender, you’ll have your life as a reward of war. 3The king of Babylon’s army is going to capture the city.’”

4The officials told the king, “Execute him. He’s discouraging the fighting men in the city and the people by telling them things like that. He’s not looking out for their welfare, but their harm.”

item.title: Jeremiah 39
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 39

1In the tenth month, ninth year of Zedekiah, king of Judah, Nebuchadnezzar came to Jerusalem and began to lay siege to it. 2The ninth day, fourth month, eleventh year of Zedekiah, they breached the wall. 3The officials of the king of Babylon came in and sat down at the Middle Gate: Nergal-sharezer the Samgar, Nebo-sarsekim the Rabsaris, Nergal-sharezer the Rabmag, and the rest. 4When Zedekiah and his soldiers saw them, they fled at night by way of the king’s garden through the gate between the two walls and headed toward the Arabah. 5But the Babylonian army caught up with him in the plains of Jericho. They captured him and took him up to Nebuchadnezzar at Riblah in Hamath, and he passed sentence on him. 6He executed Zedekiah’s sons right in front of him and executed the nobles of Judah. 7Then he put out Zedekiah’s eyes, bound him in bronze restraints, and took him to Babylon. 8The Babylonians burned the king’s palace and the people’s houses and tore down the walls around Jerusalem. 9Nebuchadnezzar exiled to Babylon the rest of the people in the city and the ones that defected to him. 10Nebuzaradan, captain of the bodyguard, left some people in Judah that didn’t have anything, and gave them vineyards and fields.

item.title: Jeremiah 40
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 40

1A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah After Nebuzaradan Released Him from Ramah, When He’d Taken Him Bound in Chains Among the Exiles from Jerusalem and Judah That Were Being Exiled to Babylon Jeremiah Freed

2The captain of the bodyguard took Jeremiah and told him, “Yahveh your God declared this catastrophe on this place. 3He brought it on and did what he declared. Because your people sinned against him and didn’t listen to him, this happened to youpl. 4But I’m freeing yousg from your chains. If you prefer to come with me to Babylon, come along. I’ll take care of you. But if you prefer not to, don’t. The whole land is open to you. Go wherever seems right. 5Go to Gedaliah Ben-Ahikam Ben-Shaphan that the king of Babylon has appointed over the towns in Judah. Stay with him among the people or go somewhere else.” So he gave him a ration and a gift, and released him. 6Jeremiah went to Mizpah to Gedaliah and stayed with him among the people left in the land.

item.title: Jeremiah 41
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 41

1In the seventh month, Ishmael Ben-Nethaniah Ben-Elishama from the royal family and a chief officer of the king, along

with 10

men, came to Gedaliah at Mizpah. While they were eating there, 2Ishmael and the 10 men got up and struck down Gedaliah with the sword. 3He also struck down the Jews that were with Gedaliah as well as the Babylonian soldiers there. Jer 41:1-3

4The next day, before anybody knew what had happened, 580 men came from Shechem, Shiloh, and Samaria with their beards shaved off, their clothes torn, and their bodies gashed. They had grain offerings and incense to present at Yahveh’s Temple. 6Ishmael went out of Mizpah to meet them, weeping as he went. When he met them, he said, “Come in to Gedaliah.” 7But as soon as they came in the city, he and the men killed them and threw them in a cistern. 8

item.title: Jeremiah 42
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 42

1Then Johanan, his commanders, Jezaniah Ben-Hoshaiah, and the people least to greatest came 2to Jeremiah, “Please honor our petition. Pray for us to Yahveh your God for this remnant. There are just a few of us left, as you can see. 3Pray that Yahveh will tell us what we should do.”

4Jeremiah said, “I’ll pray to him and not keep back a word of his answer.”

item.title: Jeremiah 43
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 43

1As soon as Jeremiah finished, 2Azariah Ben-Hoshaiah, Johanan Ben-Kareah, and the arrogant men told him, “You’re lying. Yahveh didn’t say not to go live in Egypt. 3Baruch Ben-Neriah is prompting you to turn us over to the Babylonians so they can execute us or exile us to Babylon.” 4-5So Johanan and the commanders took to Egypt the entire remnant that had come back from the countries where they’d been driven: 6men, women, children, the king’s daughters, everyone Nebuzaradan had left with Gedaliah, together with Jeremiah and Baruch. 7They got as far as Tahpanhes.

item.title: Jeremiah 44
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 44

1A Message to Jeremiah for the Jews Living in Egypt in Migdol, Tahpanhes, Memphis, and the Territory of Pathros Disaster Because of Idolatry 2“Yahveh of Hosts, the God of Israel, says, ‘You’ve seen the catastrophe I brought on Jerusalem and the towns in Judah; they’re in ruins. Nobody’s living in them 3because their sinfulness made me angry. They kept serving and burning sacrifices to gods they and their ancestors hadn’t known. 4Yet I sent them my prophets time and again, saying not to do that detestable thing. 5‘But they didn’t listen, turn from their sin, or quit burning sacrifices to other gods. 6So my anger boiled over and burned in the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem.’ 7Now Yahveh says, ‘Why harm yourselves and slay man and woman, child and infant, from Judah and leave yourselves without even a remnant? 8You’ve made me angry with the things you’ve made with your hands and the sacrifices you’ve burned to other gods in Egypt. You’ll be destroyed and become a curse and disgrace among the nations. 9Have you forgotten your ancestors’ sinfulness, the sinfulness of Judah’s kings and their wives, the sinfulness you and your wives committed in Judah and the streets of Jerusalem? 10You haven’t humbled yourselves or respected me to this day or followed the Law and statutes I set before you and your ancestors.’

item.title: Jeremiah 45
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 45

1The Message Jeremiah Spoke to Baruch When He’d Written It in a Scroll at Jeremiah’s Dictation in the Fourth Year of Jehoiakim Ben-Josiah, King of Judah A Message for Baruch 2“This is what Yahveh God of Israel says to you, Baruch: 3‘You said, “Misfortune awaits me! Yahveh has added sorrow to pain. I’m exhausted from groaning. I can’t sleep.”’ 4Tell him Yahveh says, ‘What I’ve built up I’m about to tear down. What I’ve planted I’m about to uproot—the whole land. 5Are you anticipating great things for yourself? Don’t. I’m going to bring disaster on everybody, but I’ll give you your life as a reward of war wherever you go.’”

item.title: Jeremiah 46
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 46

1A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah About the Nations

2A Message to Egypt about Pharaoh Necho’s Army That Was by the Euphrates River at Carchemish, Which Nebuchadnezzar Defeated in the Fourth Year of Jehoiakim Ben-Josiah, King of Judah A Message About Egypt 3“Line up the shields and bucklers, and advance for battle!

4Harness the horses, mount the steeds, take your positions, put your helmets on! Polish the spears; put on the coats of mail!

item.title: Jeremiah 47
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 47

1A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah About the Philistines Before Pharaoh Conquered Gaza

2Yahveh says, “A flood is swelling up from the north; it will become a tsunami. It’ll flood the land and everything in it, the cities and those who live in them. People will cry out; everybody in the land will wail.

3Because of the noise of stallions, rushing chariots, wheels, fathers won’t look back for their children; they’ll be too overwhelmed

item.title: Jeremiah 48
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 48

1About Moab Yahveh of hosts, the God of Israel, says, “Misfortune awaits Nebo—laid waste; Kiriathaim will be disgraced—taken; the fortress will be humiliated—torn down.

2No more renown for Moab; disaster’s in store for Heshbon to cease being a nation! Put Madmen to silence too; chase it with a sword.

Jer 48:1-2

3“An outcry from Horonaim, ‘Devastation and destruction!’

4Moab’s to be destroyed; its little ones cry out in terror.

item.title: Jeremiah 49
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 49

1About Ammon Yahveh says, “Doesn’t Israel have any descendants? Doesn’t he have an heir? Why then has Malcam/Milcom taken possession of Gad, and his people settled in its towns?

2The time’s coming when I’ll raise the battle cry against Rabbah of the Ammonites. It’ll be a desolate mound; its towns will be burned, Then Israel will expel the ones that expelled him.

Jer 49:1-2

3“Wail, Heshbon, because Ai is destroyed! Cry out, young women of Rabbah; put on burlap and lament; run back and forth inside the walls. Malcam/Milcom will go into exile along with his priests and officials.

4Why do you brag about your fertile valleys? Your valleys are flowing away, unfaithful daughter that trusts in her treasures and says, ‘Who’s going to attack me?’

item.title: Jeremiah 50
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 50

1A Message Yahveh Spoke About Babylon, the Land of the Babylonians, Through the Prophet Jeremiah: 2“Announce it among the nations; hoist a standard everyone can see: ‘Babylon has been captured, Bel humbled, Marduk shattered, its images disgraced, its idols smashed.’

3A nation has come down against it from the north. It will make the land something to abhor; nobody will live there. People and animals will wander off. 4“At that time, Israel and Judah will return home. They’ll go along weeping, looking for Yahveh their God. 5They’ll ask how to get to Zion and turn in that direction to join Yahveh in an everlasting covenant they won’t forget.

item.title: Jeremiah 51
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 51

1Yahveh says, “I’m going to stir up the spirit of the destroyer against Babylon and the people in Leb-kamai.

2I’ll send foreign winnowers to Babylon to devastate its land. On every side they’ll oppose it at the time of its catastrophe.

3Let the defending archer not bend his bow or stand in his coat of mail. Don’t spare the young men; devote the whole army to destruction.

item.title: Jeremiah 52
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 52

1Zedekiah

was 21

when he became king and ruled for 11 years in Jerusalem. His mother was Hamutal Bat-Jeremiah of Libnah. 2He did all the evil Jehoiakim had done. 3Because of Yahveh’s anger over that, he put Jerusalem and Judah out of his presence. Zedekiah revolted against the king of Babylon. 4The tenth day, tenth month, ninth year of Zedekiah’s reign, Nebuchadnezzar came with his army, set up camp against Jerusalem, and built a siege wall around it. 5The city lay under siege till Zedekiah’s eleventh year. 6The ninth day, fourth month, the famine was so severe in the city that the people didn’t have any food left. 7Then they broke into the city, and the fighting men fled at night through the gate between the two walls by the king’s garden, even though the Babylonians were all around the city. They went toward the Arabah, 8but the Babylonian army overtook the king in the plains by Jericho. His whole army scattered from him. 9They captured him and took him up to the king of Babylon at Riblah in Hamath, and he passed sentence on him. 10He executed Zedekiah’s sons right in front of him and executed the officials of Judah. 11Then he put out Zedekiah’s eyes, bound him with bronze bonds, and took him to Babylon. He put him in prison till his death. Jer 52:1-11 The Temple Burned

12The tenth day, fifth month, nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar, Nebuzaradan, captain of the king of Babylon’s bodyguard, came to Jerusalem. 13He burned Yahveh’s Temple, the king’s palace, the houses in Jerusalem, and the important buildings. 14The Babylonian army tore down the walls around Jerusalem. 15Nebuzaradan took into exile some of the poorest people, people left in the city, those who defected to the king of Babylon, and the rest of the artisans. 16He left some destitute to dress grapevines and plow fields.
